modules.description: This module handles operations for converting and comparing ISO 639-3 language codes, including partial mappings to ISO 639-1 and 639-2 standards, and supports checking code scope (individual, macro, or special) while retrieving macrolanguage members. It works with abstract language types and string representations, enabling tasks like standardizing language identifiers or processing multilingual data. Specific use cases include internationalization workflows and data normalization where cross-referencing language codes across ISO standards is required.

Provides equality, comparison, and pretty-printing for language families and groups defined by ISO 639-5, along with conversions between these entities and 16-bit integers, strings, and ISO 639-1/639-2 codes. Supports injection into and restriction from a combined language type, and checks for presence in ISO 639-1 and 639-2. Enables precise mapping between language family identifiers and their standardized representations.

This module handles operations for managing ISO 639-3 and 639-5 language codes, including conversions between 2- and 3-letter codes, equality checks, comparisons, and mappings across ISO standards. It works with an abstract language type `t` and supports distinctions between individual, macro, collective, and special language categories. Specific use cases include converting language families to ISO 639-5 codes, validating code scopes, and integrating multilingual data across different ISO parts.

Provides functions to convert between ISO 639-3 language codes and their corresponding abstract type, along with operations to handle language families using ISO 639-5 codes. Works with abstract types representing languages and language families, ensuring precise mapping and conversion. Used to standardize language identification in multilingual applications and data processing pipelines.

Handles language code conversions, comparisons, and mappings across ISO 639-3, 639-2, and 639-5 standards, supporting operations on abstract language types, string representations, and 16-bit integers. Provides checks for code scope, equality, and comparisons, along with mappings between language families, groups, and standardized codes. Enables tasks such as converting between 2- and 3-letter codes, validating language categories, and integrating multilingual data. Supports internationalization workflows by ensuring consistent representation and cross-referencing of language identifiers.
